intro: Osbeckia courtallensis, commonly known as the Sri Lankan willow weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to tropical Asia, particularly found in countries like Sri Lanka, India, and Indonesia. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and alternate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom during the warmer months. Osbeckia courtallensis is adapted to thrive in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides.
